metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: SQL LIKE Operator
The SQL LIKE Operator
The LIKE operator is used in a WHERE clause to search for a specified pattern in a column.
content.html: The LIKE operator is used in a WHERE clause to search for a specified pattern in a column.

content.text: There are two wildcards often used in conjunction with the LIKE operator:
content.html: There are two wildcards often used in conjunction with the LIKE operator:

content.text: You will learn more about wildcards in the next chapter .
content.html: You will learn more about wildcards in the next chapter.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%';

content.text: Syntax

content.code: SELECT column1, column2, ... FROM table_name WHERE columnN LIKE pattern ;

content.text: Demo Database
Below is a selection from the Customers table used in the examples:
content.html: Below is a selection from the Customers table used in the examples:

content.code_html:
CustomerID CustomerName ContactName Address City PostalCode Country

 Alfreds Futterkiste Maria Anders Obere Str. 57 Berlin 12209 Germany

content.text: The _ Wildcard
The _ wildcard represents a single character.
It can be any character or number, but each _ represents one, and only one, character.
content.html: It can be any character or number, but each _ represents one, and only one, character.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE city LIKE 'L_nd__';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE city LIKE 'L_nd__';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE city LIKE 'L_nd__';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE city LIKE 'L_nd__';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE city LIKE 'L_nd__';

content.text: The % Wildcard
The % wildcard represents any number of characters, even zero characters.
content.html: The % wildcard represents any number of characters, even zero characters.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE city LIKE '%L%';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE city LIKE '%L%';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE city LIKE '%L%';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE city LIKE '%L%';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE city LIKE '%L%';

content.text: Starts With
To return records that starts with a specific letter or phrase, add the % at the end of the letter or phrase.
content.html: To return records that starts with a specific letter or phrase, add the % at the end of the letter or phrase.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'La%';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'La%';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'La%';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'La%';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'La%';

content.text: Tip: You can also combine any number of conditions using AND or OR operators.
content.html: Tip: You can also combine any number of conditions using AND or OR operators.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%' OR CustomerName LIKE 'b%';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%' OR CustomerName LIKE 'b%';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%' OR CustomerName LIKE 'b%';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%' OR CustomerName LIKE 'b%';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a%' OR CustomerName LIKE 'b%';

content.text: Ends With
To return records that ends with a specific letter or phrase, add the % at the beginning of the letter or phrase.
content.html: To return records that ends with a specific letter or phrase, add the % at the beginning of the letter or phrase.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%a';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%a';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%a';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%a';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%a';

content.text: Tip: You can also combine "starts with" and "ends with":
content.html: Tip: You can also combine "starts with" and "ends with":

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'b%s';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'b%s';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'b%s';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'b%s';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'b%s';

content.text: Contains
To return records that contains a specific letter or phrase, add the % both before and after the letter or phrase.
content.html: To return records that contains a specific letter or phrase, add the % both before and after the letter or phrase.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%or%';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%or%';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%or%';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%or%';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE '%or%';

content.text: Combine Wildcards
Any wildcard, like % and _ , can be used in combination with other wildcards.
content.html: Any wildcard, like % and _ , can be used in combination with other wildcards.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a__%';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a__%';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a__%';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a__%';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE 'a__%';

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE '_r%';

content.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE '_r%';

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
 WHERE CustomerName LIKE '_r%';

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE CustomerName LIKE '_r%';

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT * FROM Customers
  WHERE CustomerName LIKE '_r%';

content.text: Without Wildcard
If no wildcard is specified, the phrase has to have an exact match to return a result.
content.html: If no wildcard is specified, the phrase has to have an exact match to return a result.

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE Country LIKE 'Spain';

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What does the SQL LIKE operator do?

metadata.question: What does the SQL LIKE operator do?

options.text: Groups records based on a condition
Returns the largest value in a column
Searches for a specified pattern in a column

Returns the largest value in a column
Searches for a specified pattern in a column
